title: Red-faced Pak army chief makes desperate claim after India exposes axis with China & Turkey
content: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, refuted claims of external assistance during the recent conflict with India, dismissing them as false and an attempt to undermine Pakistan's capabilities. He criticized India for involving other nations in a bilateral issue and warned of a strong response to any future aggression.

title: The Xi question: Is China's 'leader for life' planning his exit?
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping is reportedly delegating authority to key Communist Party institutions, sparking speculation about a potential power transition or retirement plans. This shift comes amid economic pressures, including trade tensions with the US and a housing market slump.

title: Russian minister ends life hours after being fired by Putin
content: Former Russian transport minister Roman Starovoit allegedly died by suicide with an awarded firearm shortly after being dismissed by President Vladimir Putin. His sacking followed significant flight cancellations and delays at Moscow's Sheremetyevo and St Petersburg's Pulkovo airports, reportedly due to Ukrainian drone attacks. Andrey Nikitin has been appointed as the acting transport minister.

title: IND vs ENG: Vaughan lambasts England player after loss - 'He has to count himself fortunate'
content: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has strongly criticised Zak Crawley's inconsistent Test performance, questioning his place despite a recent 65 against India. Geoffrey Boycott echoed these concerns, citing Crawley's ingrained flaws and insufficient run-scoring. India's victory at Edgbaston, fueled by Akash Deep's bowling, intensified scrutiny on England's team selection, including Chris Woakes' declining performance, prompting calls for strategic changes.

title: China goes off the rails after PM wishes Dalai Lama on his b'day
content: China has lodged a formal protest with India following Prime Minister Modi's birthday greetings to the Dalai Lama and the attendance of Indian officials at his 90th birthday celebrations. Beijing views the Dalai Lama as a separatist and accuses India of interfering in its internal affairs.

title: Tesla board urged to question Elon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: Shubman Gill effect! Former batter warns England - 'Come up with an answer'
content: Mark Butcher lauded Shubman Gill's composure and technique as India's Test captain, highlighting his success in Virat Kohli's former position. Gill's impressive form in the England series, with 585 runs, has solidified his position. Butcher also praised KL Rahul's consistency and Yashasvi Jaiswal's hunger for runs, calling Jaiswal a generational talent.

title: Language row: RSS backs regional languages for primary education
content: Amidst the ongoing language debate, the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) advocates for primary education in local languages. This statement follows the rollback of the three-language policy by Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu. The RSS emphasizes that all Indian languages are national languages.

title: After 'I will try to score 200 next time' remark, Suryavanshi now scores ...
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the young batting prodigy, followed up his record-breaking century with a composed 33 against England U19. His innings provided a solid start for India, who were interrupted by rain after posting 164/7. Suryavanshi's ambition to score a double-century, inspired by Shubman Gill, fuels anticipation for the final Youth ODI as he aims to fulfill his dream.

title: GitHub CEO: 'Smartest' firms will hire more software engineers, not fewer
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

title: Iranian prez accuses Tel Aviv of attempting to assassinate him
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian claimed that Israel attempted to assassinate him by bombing the location of a meeting he was attending. In an interview with Tucker Carlson, Pezeshkian stated that Israel was responsible for the failed attempt, clarifying that the United States was not involved. However, he did not specify when this alleged assassination attempt occurred.

title: Wimbledon: Federer greeted with roaring applause after surprise appearance - Watch
content: Roger Federer and his wife Mirka graced Wimbledon on Day 8, receiving a warm welcome as they headed to the Royal Box. Federer, an eight-time Wimbledon champion, looked dapper in a navy blue suit, while Mirka wore a white dress. The Tennis great was welcomed with roaring applause by the crowd as he made his way to his seat.

title: 'Happy' to play with CSK captain, Prithvi Shaw joins Maharashtra - details inside
content: Prithvi Shaw is set to represent Maharashtra in the upcoming 2025/26 domestic season, securing a no-objection certificate from Mumbai. Shaw expressed gratitude to the Mumbai Cricket Association, citing the move as crucial for his growth. He looks forward to joining talents like Ruturaj Gaikwad and believes Maharashtra's progressive cricketing infrastructure will positively impact his career.

title: Bill Gates out of world’s 10 richest man list; net worth falls 30% in 7 days
content: Bill Gates has fallen out of the top ten richest people due to a recalculation reflecting his significant charitable donations. His net worth decreased by $52 billion, moving him to twelfth place, while Steve Ballmer, his former assistant and Microsoft's ex-CEO, now ranks higher with $172 billion.

title: Uddhav asks 'did Pahalgam terrorists join BJP?'; takes 'washing powder' jab
content: Uddhav Thackeray criticized BJP regarding the Pahalgam terror incident. He questioned the whereabouts of the terrorists. Thackeray's remarks followed BJP leaders comparing the Hindi-Marathi row to the Pahalgam attack. Ashish Shelar equated the pain of the terror attack with the violence against Hindi speakers. Sanjay Raut condemned Shelar's comparison. Nishikant Dubey likened opposition parties to terrorists amid the language controversy. Dubey's statements further fueled the ongoing debate.

title: NPS vs UPS: Big move for govt employees! NPS tax benefits now under UPS
content: To boost the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), the Finance Ministry has extended National Pension System (NPS) income tax benefits to it. This move addresses tax treatment concerns, potentially increasing UPS adoption among central government employees. The deadline to switch from NPS to UPS has been extended to September 30, 2025, allowing more time for assessment.

title: Chess | ‘Carlsen’s respect for Gukesh is only going to grow’ – What does it even mean?
content: Magnus Carlsen secured victory at the Super United Rapid and Blitz in Croatia, overshadowing reigning World Champion Gukesh Dommaraju. Despite Carlsen's recent criticisms and subtle jabs towards Gukesh's abilities, the young challenger has consistently responded with strong performances on the board. This rivalry marks a significant transition in world chess, reminiscent of Carlsen's own rise to challenge established legends.

title: NFL fans can’t stop watching Watson and Jilly Anais’s TikToks and it’s easy to see why
content: Deshaun Watson and Jilly Anais are captivating the internet with their dreamy wedding and honeymoon content. Their TikTok videos, filled with designer gowns, ocean views, and playful moments, have created a viral aesthetic. The couple's genuine chemistry and luxurious lifestyle are drawing in fans, even those typically outside the NFL world, as Jilly embraces her "wifey-core" era.

title: 'Boosted momentum': Pirate Software as Stop Killing Games hits 1 million signatures
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: Travis Kelce holds off on proposing to Taylor Swift
content: Amidst swirling speculation, sources indicate that Travis Kelce is unlikely to propose to Taylor Swift imminently. While their bond is strong, Kelce reportedly plans to wait until his NFL retirement before making it official, prioritizing his football career. Swift, meanwhile, is focusing on personal growth and enjoying downtime after her Eras Tour, spending quality time with Kelce and family.

title: Drunk, shirtless MNS leader's son abuses woman, flaunts father's clout; FIR filed
content: Raj Thackeray's MNS faced criticism after a video surfaced showing an MNS leader's son, Rahil Shaikh, verbally abusing a Marathi-speaking woman following a car accident. Rahil, allegedly intoxicated, flaunted his father's political connections during the incident. Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Nirupam questioned MNS's commitment to Marathi pride in light of the event.

title: 'On wrong side again': BJP attacks Rahul's 'obsession' with China
content: The BJP has accused Rahul Gandhi of supporting Chinese military technology and undermining the Indian armed forces. Amit Malviya criticized Gandhi for questioning the use of Indian forces and spreading misinformation about the stock market. Malviya highlighted the Modi government's reforms and the growth of India's stock market, contrasting it with financial scandals during Congress rule.

title: 'Texas closer to his heart': Cong's swipe at PM Modi for silence over Mandi disaster
content: Congress has launched a strong critique against PM Modi, questioning his silence on the devastating floods in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi, where numerous lives have been lost. This criticism arose after the Prime Minister expressed condolences for the flood-related deaths in Texas, USA. The opposition party suggests a disparity in the Prime Minister's concern for domestic and international tragedies.

title: IND vs ENG: Shubman Gill shares most special Edgbaston moment - Watch
content: Shubman Gill expressed immense pride after India's dominant 337-run victory over England at Edgbaston, emphasizing the team's all-round performance and collective effort. He highlighted the significance of securing a historic Test win in a previously unconquered territory. Gill cherished the victory, particularly Siraj's catch, as a testament to the team's hard work and unity, marking it as a career highlight.

title: Grounded F-35 in Kerala: UK thanks India for support; says repairs 'under way'
content: A Royal Navy F-35B fighter, grounded in Thiruvananthapuram since June 14 due to an emergency landing, has been moved to a maintenance hangar for repairs. The UK Ministry of Defence expressed gratitude to Indian authorities for their support. British engineers arrived via RAF aircraft with specialized equipment to fix the aircraft, which experienced issues during refuelling.

title: RBI floating rate bond offers 8.05% return: FRSB outperforms most bank FDs, PPF
content: Reserve Bank of India keeps the Floating Rate Savings Bonds interest rate at 8.05% for July to December 2025. This rate is higher than many bank fixed deposits. These bonds offer safety and good returns. The rate is linked to National Savings Certificate and recalibrated every six months. These bonds are good for long-term conservative investors seeking steady income.

title: 'Centre handicapped': VP explains why no FIR against Justice Varma in cash row
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted the constraints faced by the government in registering an FIR in the Justice Yashwant Varma case, citing a decades-old judicial order.

title: Darshan case rerun? B'luru youth stripped, thrashed for obscene msg to minor
content: In Bengaluru, eight individuals were apprehended for kidnapping and assaulting a youth who allegedly threatened to reveal a minor girl's past relationships to her family. The victim and the girl were previously in a relationship, and after their separation, he threatened to expose her affairs.

title: Astronaut Shukla speaks to Isro chief; gives big update on ISS experiments
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, currently on the ISS as part of the Axiom-4 mission, spoke with Isro chairman V Narayanan on July 6, 2025, about his health, mission progress, and scientific work. Shukla's observations and inputs are expected to significantly contribute to the Gaganyaan mission. Isro continues to provide mission support, with regular interactions with standby astronaut Prashant Balan Nair.

title: 'India's minorities are hostages': Owaisi slams Rijiju over 'benefits' claim
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Kiren Rijiju's claim that minorities in India receive more benefits than the majority. Owaisi refuted this statement, highlighting the discrimination and violence faced by Muslims, including instances of lynching, property demolitions, and hate speech.

title: Setback for Celebi: HC junks Turkish firm's plea over airport security clearance
content: The Delhi High Court upheld the revocation of Turkey-based Çelebi's security clearance by the BCAS, citing national security concerns. This decision followed intelligence inputs suggesting Çelebi's operations posed a risk, particularly given geopolitical tensions. Çelebi, responsible for ground handling at several Indian airports, argued the revocation violated natural justice, but the court sided with the government's assessment of an 'unprecedented' threat.

title: Nora Fatehi breaks down at Mumbai airport, her bodyguard pushes away fan
content: Nora Fatehi sparked concern among fans after she was spotted crying at Mumbai airport on Sunday evening (July 6). Dressed in an all-black ensemble and wearing dark sunglasses, the actress appeared visibly emotional as she walked through the airport terminal. Despite trying to hold back tears, the paparazzi continued clicking pictures, capturing her sombre state.

title: Musk posts 'arrest counter' of Epstein case; fresh dig at Trump?
content: Elon Musk posted an "arrest counter" on X, highlighting zero arrests in the Jeffrey Epstein case, seemingly targeting Donald Trump. This follows reports that the DOJ and FBI found no evidence Epstein was murdered or blackmailed powerful figures. Musk previously alleged Trump's name appears in sealed documents related to the case.

title: All-party MPs forum writes Centre to confer Dalai Lama with Bharat Ratna
content: Indian MPs from various parties are backing the Dalai Lama. They want him to receive the Bharat Ratna. The MPs also want him to address the Parliament. They oppose China's interference in Tibetan spiritual matters. The forum supports a pro-Tibet bill. They are also pushing for better amenities for Tibetan settlements. This action highlights India's ongoing diplomatic challenge with China.

title: TN TRB result 2024 declared: Final answer key, scorecard released for 1,768 teacher posts
content: Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board released the Secondary Grade Teacher Exam results. The exam was held on July 21, 2024. It aimed to fill 1,768 teacher vacancies. Candidates can check results on trb.tn.gov.in. The board also published the final answer key. Shortlisted candidates will undergo certificate verification. The board will announce the verification dates soon.

title: IND vs ENG: He is not going to be a Kohli type character - Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy following India's massive victory at Edgbaston, leveling the Test series. Hussain noted Gill's visible leadership, contrasting it with perceived ambiguity in previous matches. He highlighted Gill's calm demeanor and tactical decisions, such as Akash Deep's bowling arrangement, which proved effective. Hussain emphasized that Gill's primary responsibility is scoring runs, which he has accomplished successfully.

title: Pak honours Kargil 'hero' it once disowned; had refused to accept body in 1999
content: Pakistan's army chief honored Captain Karnal Sher Khan, a Kargil war "martyr," despite initially refusing to accept his body after it was found on Tiger Hill. India stated that Pakistan denied acknowledging its army's involvement in Kargil, refusing to identify Khan to conceal their role and disservice the families of their soldiers.

title: Hailee Steinfeld finds peace at home as Trubisky gives Josh Allen added security
content: The Buffalo Bills have re-signed veteran quarterback Mitchell Trubisky to bolster their quarterback depth behind Josh Allen, providing crucial insurance for the team's Super Bowl aspirations. Allen's partnership with Hailee Steinfeld remains strong, with their wedding celebrated by teammates, including Trubisky. This move brings stability and peace of mind as Allen aims to bring the Lombardi Trophy to Buffalo.

title: 'Tariffs being used as tool of coercion': China responds to Trump’s threat to Brics
content: China has firmly responded to President Trump's threat of additional tariffs on BRICS nations, asserting that such measures are unproductive and serve no constructive purpose. Beijing emphasized that the BRICS bloc is dedicated to cooperation and inclusive global development, rejecting confrontation and geopolitical rivalry. The Chinese Foreign Ministry reiterated its opposition to using tariffs as a tool for political coercion.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Very tempting to play Kuldeep, but ...': Gill explains selection call
content: Shubman Gill explained Washington Sundar's inclusion over Kuldeep Yadav was to strengthen batting depth, a decision vindicated by Sundar's all-round performance in India's historic Edgbaston win. Gill highlighted the importance of spin in controlling the game when the Dukes ball softens, and his aggressive strategies during England's innings. He dismissed the Edgbaston jinx, crediting dedicated Test preparation for his form.

title: 10-min delivery: Cost of convenience & what happens when discounts vanish
content: Quick commerce platforms like Swiggy Instamart and Blinkit are facing consumer pushback due to rising fees, including handling, delivery, and surge charges. This is prompting shoppers to compare prices with local vendors and plan purchases to avoid extra costs.

title: BJP says Chirag Paswan's LJP will contest as ally in Bihar; Cong's 'weather scientist' dig
content: Chirag Paswan's announcement to field LJP candidates for all 243 Bihar seats has stirred reactions. BJP interprets Paswan's move as contesting within the NDA, anticipating a united front. Conversely, Congress predicts Paswan's departure from the NDA post-election, foreseeing a BJP defeat under Nitish Kumar's leadership. LJP's past performance highlights its potential to influence election outcomes, particularly impacting JD(U) prospects.

title: Hoping for a US H-1B visa? Trump administration's stringent scrutiny likely
content: Indian H-1B visa aspirants should brace for potential challenges under Donald Trump's second term, experts warn. Anticipate increased rejection rates, mirroring trends from his initial presidency, alongside extended processing times and more rigorous documentation requests.

title: WTC: India open account with record Edgbaston win; Australia top early standings
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy led India to a dominant 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston, marking their first win in the ongoing five-match Test series and earning them 12 WTC points. This victory, India's biggest-ever away Test win, levels the series at 1-1. Australia currently lead the WTC standings with a perfect PCT, while India and England are joint-third.

title: What’s bigger than an anaconda? This 58-million-year-old fossil may have the answer
content: Fossil remains unearthed in Colombia's Cerrejón coal mine reveal Titanoboa cerrejonensis, the largest snake ever discovered, dating back 58 million years. This colossal serpent, reaching up to 14 meters and weighing over a tonne, thrived in a hot, swampy rainforest. Its discovery provides invaluable insights into reptilian evolution, ancient tropical ecosystems, and the climate conditions of the Paleocene Epoch.

title: 'They asked me to raze house': PMAY glitch forces 80 y/o widow to live under tree
content: Gaura Bai, an 80-year-old widow from Madhya Pradesh, faces homelessness due to a software glitch in the PM Awas Yojna. After being instructed to demolish her mud house in anticipation of a new one, she and her family have been living under a tree for ten months.

title: Siddaramaiah has instructed Rayaraddi to say govt. has no funds, says Ramesh Jigajinagi
content: The latter’s statement should be viewed seriously as he holds a responsible position in the govt., according to the BJP MP

title: Digital Seva Kendras not intended to provide services similar to Akshaya centres, says Rutronix
content: Akshaya forum expresses relief over the statement from Rutronix, says that it is no longer opposed to the opening of the Digital Seva Kendras

title: Eluru SC Welfare officer urges students to link Aadhaar with bank accounts
content: In order to receive the ‘Thalliki Vandhanam’ scheme benefit, the bank account must be in the student’s name and linked with their Aadhaar number through the National Payments Corporation of India system, says Y. Vishwamohan Reddy

title: Registrar row throws Kerala University into administrative chaos
content: After Syndicate reinstates suspended Registrar K.S. Anil Kumar, interim V-C Ciza Thomas appoints Mini Dejo Kappen as Registrar through a separate order, stating that Syndicate’s decision is legally invalid

title: LDF government, Raj Bhavan equally responsible for wrecking higher education sector: V.D. Satheesan
content: Majority of the universities in the State have no full-time Vice-Chancellors. Administration is carried out by “in-charge” VCs, he said.

title: Meghalaya's Sohra, considered world's wettest place, records a third of rainfall in June
content: “Since 2005, Sohra has received only about 8,000 mm to 9,000 mm of rain annually, against a normal average of about 11,000 mm,” he said

title: Tension at NTRUHS as students clash with police opposing privatisation of government medical colleges
content: Led by YSRCP students’ wing leaders, protestors demand that the 17 government medical colleges, established during the tenure of former Chief Minister Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy, should not be handed over to private partners under the Public-Private Partnership model

title: Collector bans off-road MUV safari in Idukki
content: Drivers of MUVs stage protests claiming that the sudden ban has affected thousands of people who are dependent on income from off-road safaris

title: Over 20 crore Indians moved out of extreme poverty in the past decade: Lanka Dinakar
content: He attributes this progress to flagship initiatives like Jan Dhan Yojana, which enabled direct benefit transfers of over ₹45 lakh crore to 55 crore bank accounts

title: Who are the NFL's best running backs? Execs, coaches and scouts help rank 2025's top 10
content: Execs, coaches, scouts and players from around the league ranked their top 10 in our annual summer series.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Durant to Rockets part of NBA-first 7-team trade
content: A series of moves going back to Kevin Durant's trade to the Houston Rockets before the draft ultimately became the first seven-team trade in NBA history.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks
content: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

title: Sources: Nuggets expect Valanciunas to honor deal
content: The Denver Nuggets have informed Jonas Valanciunas ' representatives that the franchise fully expects the center to honor his contract, sources said.

title: Two-time champ Alonso declines HR Derby invite
content: Two-time champ Pete Alonso of the Mets told reporters Sunday that he will skip the Home Run Derby in Atlanta, adding, "I have never really fully enjoyed the three off days, so I just want to be in the best possible position to help this team win."

title: Pirates CF Cruz makes 105.2 mph throw to plate
content: Pirates center fielder Oneil Cruz made a 105.2 mph throw to nab Seattle's J.P. Crawford at the plate on Sunday, the second-hardest thrown ball to produce an outfield assist since Statcast started tracking in 2015.

title: 📋 MLB draft guide: Latest intel for all 30 teams
content: Who will the Nationals take No. 1? Who is atop your team's board? Kiley McDaniel lays it all out as draft week arrives.

title: MLB GMs tell their best (and wildest) trade stories: 'I had to go in the basement of the bar where all the liquor is being stored'
content: From texts during life events to the best deadline deals that never happened, MLB front office execs tell all.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: NBA insiders examine free agency's first week: Best moves, biggest risks
content: Which deals will impact the title race? Which will leave teams in regret by Christmas? Our NBA insiders make their picks.

title: USMNT's real test from here will be learning from Gold Cup final loss to Mexico
content: There were plenty of difficult lessons for the USMNT in the Gold Cup final loss to Mexico on Sunday. How Mauricio Pochettino & Co. respond will be telling.

title: What Nationals' overhaul means for their No. 1 draft pick, trade deadline plans
content: Washington fired its GM and manager as draft and trade season heat up. Here's how the fallout could play out.

title: Three rookies, five first-time honorees highlight All-Star roster
content: Indiana and Seattle each put three players on the All-Star Game roster, which also includes a trio of rookies.

title: From WrestleMania moves to showing off his jump shot: How Pete Carroll is rebuilding Raiders culture
content: Carroll's competitive nature and fun-loving spirit is palpable, and the Raiders are hoping their new approach will translate to wins.

title: Running back rankings: Who are the most reliable TD scorers?
content: From Jahmyr Gibbs and Derrick Henry to Bijan Robinson, we rank the running backs based on the most dependable at finding the end zone.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Lando Norris on British GP final lap: Don't mess it up
content: As Lando Norris closed in on home victory at the British Grand Prix, he had one overriding thought in his head: "Just don't f--- it up."

title: Musiala fractures left leg in Donnarumma collision
content: Bayern Munich said Jamal Musiala faces a "lengthy" recovery from a left leg fracture after his collision with PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma.

title: Martín Zubimendi joins Arsenal from Sociedad
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of highly rated Spain midfielder Martín Zubimendi from Real Sociedad, the Premier League club have announced.

title: Spain on favourites tag: 'Don't mention that word'
content: Spain defender Olga Carmona said there is no mention of the word favourites as they prepare to face Belgium in the European Championship on Monday.

title: Norway on brink of Euros QF after Finland win
content: A late solo strike by Norway forward Caroline Graham Hansen secured a 2-1 victory against Finland in the Women's European Championship on Sunday, as the twice champions took a big step towards qualifying for the quarterfinals.

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: Madrid's Gonzalo living a 'dream' at CWC
content: Real Madrid forward Gonzalo García said he is a living a "dream" at the FIFA Club World Cup after earning comparisons to the club's legendary former striker, Raul, with four goals in five games for Los Blancos.

title: Gonzalo García proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo García could be the reason they go all the way.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Hosts Switzerland keep knockout hopes alive
content: Switzerland's win over Iceland has them on course for the knockouts. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Leão
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Leão from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gyökeres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: UAEs New Golden Visa Rule Marks Significant Shift For Indian Investors
content: The recent overhaul of the UAE's Golden Visa marks a significant shift in the country's residency landscape, industry experts said on Monday.

title: Watch: Guards Foil Theft Attempt In Delhi, Thief Abandons Bike and Escapes
content: A routine security check at Delhi's Press Enclave Society turned into a dramatic chase on Monday afternoon, when guards identified and attempted to catch a repeat offender who had previously stolen inverters from the residential colony.

title: Why Trump's $5 Million "Gold Card" US Visa May Never Become A Reality
content: Since its announcement in February, President Donald Trump's $5 million "Gold Card" has seen strong interest among overseas wealthy seeking an easy passage to US citizenship.

title: "Exclusionary Process": RJD's Manoj Jha Attacks Poll Body's Bihar Exercise
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) continues to face criticism from Opposition leaders over its voter list revisions, an exercise which former Chief Election Commissioner SY Quraishi had called the "real soft underbelly" of the institution.

title: Karnataka To Treat Sudden Deaths As "Notifiable Disease", Says Health Minister
content: The Karnataka government on Monday decided to treat sudden deaths as "notifiable disease" and conduct postmortem in such cases.

title: Naveen Patnaik Discharged From Mumbai Hospital After Surgery
content: BJD president Naveen Patnaik was on Monday discharged from a private hospital in Mumbai, where he underwent a spine surgery for cervical arthritis, a party leader said.

title: Over 3,000 Flee to Mizoram Following Armed Clashes In Myanmar's Chin State
content: Fighting between two armed Chin groups in Myanmar has forced several civilians to flee into Mizoram's Champhai. At least 2,845 people from Khawmawi and Rihkhawdar villages, which border Mizoram, have sought refuge in Zokhawthar village.

title: Tirupati Devotees To Now Also Get Vadas For Free Twice A Day
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam announced that vadas, a popular savoury snack, will now be served twice daily at the Annaprasada Kendra.

title: Madhya Pradesh Doctor Refuses Anti-Rabies Shot To Padma Awardee's Wife, Suspended
content: A doctor at a community health centre in Dhar district has been suspended for allegedly refusing to administer an anti-rabies injection to the wife of Subroto Das, a Padma Shri awardee, over the weekend, an official said on Monday.

title: Musk's "Paedophile" Dig After Team Trump's New Report In Jeffrey Epstein Case
content: US President Donald Trump's former first buddy, billionaire Elon Musk, once again stirred the Jeffrey Epstein controversy, suggesting the Republican leader's name is among the sex offender's sealed files.

title: Video: Drunk, Half-Naked Son Of MNS Leader Hurls Abuses At Woman In Mumbai
content: Amid instances of Raj Thackeray's supporters thrashing non-Marathi speakers over the language controversy in Maharashtra, a video has surfaced online embarrassing the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS).

title: Youtuber Jyoti Malhotra's Judicial Custody Extended By 14 Days In Espionage Case
content: A court here on Monday extended by 14 days the judicial custody of social media influencer Jyoti Malhotra, arrested in May, on suspicion of espionage.

title: Bengal BJP's "Powerful Shift" That Drew Trinamool's "Copycat" Jibe
content: A rather unique flashpoint has emerged in Bengal politics with the warring BJP and Trinamool claiming credit for a move that signifies the importance of the party over its leadership.

title: Class 9 Student Dies By Suicide In Assam, Note Alleges Sex Abuse By Teacher
content: A girl student in Assam's Tinsukia district, who attempted suicide in June due to alleged sex assault repeatedly by her teacher, died by suicide on July 6, the police said.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Of Prada, Dior, And Manufactured Meanings Of Luxury
content: Let's not waste breath or bites any further on Prada and Dior 'stealing' from the Indian artisanal traditions: the Kolhapuri footwear and the Muqaish embroidery.

title: Space Station To Fly Over India: A Guide To Spotting The Orbiting Lab
content: The best viewing opportunities occur within a few hours before or after sunrise or sunset when the station is illuminated by the Sun but the sky is dark enough for it to stand out.

title: "India Should Act Prudently": China Protests PM Modi's Birthday Wish To Dalai Lama
content: China said on Monday it protested to India over Prime Minister Narendra Modi's greetings to the Dalai Lama on his 90th birthday and the attendance of Indian officials at the celebrations, stressing New Delhi should fully appreciate Beijing's

title: Video: In UP, Children Carry 15-Foot Python Bare-Handed, Treat It Like A Toy
content: A massive 15-foot python became an unlikely toy for a group of children in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr. They were seen lifting the reptile with their hands, parading it through village roads, and taking selfies.

title: BJP's Big Charge Against Rahul Gandhi Over China's Anti-Rafale Campaign
content: Amid reports that China launched a misinformation campaign during Operation Sindoor to undermine Rafale sales, the BJP has launched a scathing attack on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of undermining Indian forces

title: Video: Man Tears Apart Month-Old Road By Hand In Maharashtra's Nanded
content: How long should it take before you can start tearing apart a road by hand? Centuries, you say? Well, in Maharashtra's Nanded, all it took was a month.

title: BRS ridicules Uttam’s argument on operating Kalwakurthy lift, Kannepally PH
content: Party leaders say Kalwakurthy pumps are run on availability of water and Kannepally pumps need no storage in Medigadda as Godavari is flowing at 96 meters against 93.5 m needed to run pumps

title: Andhra Pradesh Revenue Services Association refutes reports on cadre irregularities
content: The Election Deputy Tahsildar posts were created in 2008 and have functioned continuously for the past 17 years across different governments, say the association leaders

title: Eluru Collector directs private schools to conduct Mega PTM on July 10
content: The event is a key component of the State’s educational reforms, aimed at strengthening parental involvement in students’ academic progress, says K. Vetri Selvi

title: ₹10,000 crore sanctioned in Union Budget for strengthening rail infrastructure in Bihar: Vaishnaw
content: Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw also announced that the Karpoori Gram railway station would now come under the Samastipur railway division

title: Madras High Court refuses to reject election petition against AIADMK MLA Natham Viswanathan
content: Justice P.T. Asha dismisses a plea by the AIADMK MLA to reject the election petition filed against him by DMK candidate M.A. Andiambalam

title: Insurance employees celebrate 75th anniversary of AIIEA in Ballari
content: All India Insurance Employees’ Association played a historic role in advocating for the nationalisation of life insurance, a movement that culminated in the creation of LIC in 1956 under then PM Jawaharlal Nehru.

title: Governor R.N. Ravi, Chief Minister Stalin pay tributes to Rettamalai Srinivasan
content: In an official event, Minister M. Mathiventhan, Chennai Mayor R. Priya, and senior officials paid floral tributes to the late leader.

title: Espionage case: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra’s judicial custody extended till July 21
content: “Jyoti Malhotra’s judicial custody has been further extended by 14 days, and the next date of hearing has been fixed by the court on July 21,” her lawyer Kumar Mukesh said

title: 1984 anti-Sikh riots: Court records Sajjan Kumar's statement
content: Former Congress MP Sajjan Kumar proclaims innocence in 1984 anti-Sikh riots case, citing lack of evidence and political motives

title: Congress accuses PM Modi of ignoring rain-hit Mandi's plight, says Texas is closer to his heart
content: Congress criticises PM Modi for expressing condolences over Texas floods but not addressing loss of lives in Himachal Pradesh

title: Shunning Swiggy, Zomato, Namakkal restaurant owners move to Tamil Nadu-based online food delivery platform Zaaroz
content: Zaaroz is run by an entrepreneur at Chidambaram in Cuddalore district. Due to cost reduction for the owners of eateries in Namakkal following the shift, they have reduced the prices of food.

title: Luggage packed, will move out of official residence: ex-CJI Chandrachud
content: Former CJI Chandrachud lamented over the controversy and referred to the medical condition of his daughters who required a wheelchair-friendly home

title: Kaliganj blast: Deceased girl's mother alleges Mamata not allowing police to conduct probe properly
content: The deceased's mother Sabina said that she would hold a hunger strike till death if justice is not delivered

title: Youth Congress stages protest outside Kozhikode collectorate against Health Minister
content: A rally was taken out by Youth Congress activists from Eranhipalam to the collectorate premises over the death of a woman in the recent building collapse at Government Medical College Hospital, Kottayam

title: PM Modi at BRICS in Brazil LIVE: Modi to have bilateral engagements with several world leaders
content: In an address at a session on peace and security, PM Modi said the “cowardly” Pahalgam terror attack was a direct strike on the “soul, identity and dignity” of India, as he called for united efforts to combat the challenge of terrorism

title: Citizens council suggests Tiruchi airport be named after Rajendra Chola
content: The Gangaikondacholapuram Development Council Trust has sought the issue of a coin in his name “as a tribute to the achievements of the great Chola Emperor”

title: Peace time is nothing but 'illusion': Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
content: In an address at an event, Rajnath Singh said the performance of the indigenously built equipment and platforms in the operation increased the global demand for India-built military products

title: Bail plea of actors Srikanth, Krishna in drug case: Madras High Court to pass orders on July 8
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar reserves his orders on the individual bail petitions filed by the two actors who were arrested last month on charges of consuming cocaine

title: T.N. govt. extends term of special officers for 9,580 village panchayats by six more months
content: This means the SOs will remain in place till January 5, 2026, according to an order issued by the State Rural Development and Panchayat Raj (RD&PR) department’s Additional Chief Secretary Gagandeep Singh Bedi on Saturday (July 5, 2025)

title: Sudden heart attack deaths among people under age of 45 declared notifiable in Karnataka
content: Health Department took the decision on the basis of a recommendation by the expert committee that was set up to study the link between COVID-19 vaccination and sudden cardiovascular events

title: CPI condemns reports linking YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra to Kerala government
content: CPI condemns BJP’s attempt to blame Kerala government for espionage case, highlighting BJP’s national security failures

title: Pahalgam terror attack: NIA gets custody of two accused for 10 more days
content: The two were arrested on June 22 and were presented in a local court in Jammu the next day. The court initially granted the NIA five days' remand before the case was shifted to the special court

title: Chikkamagaluru DC prohibits entry of VHP leader Sharan Pumpwell to district
content: VHP leader Sharan Pumpwell is named in 20 cases registered in Udupi, Dakshina Kannada, and Tumakuru districts

title: Tamil Nadu first to integrate ‘predicted possibility of TB deaths’ in patients to its State TB elimination programme
content: More than 70% of TB deaths occur in the first two months of treatment; the new feature will alert frontline staff on how to recognise a severely ill TB patient from a given list of medical indications, ensuring swift diagnosis and immediate healthcare access for them

title: Headmistress, teacher and driver: Sister Mary wears many hats to keep this Kerala school running smoothly
content: Sr. Mary Bona Lawrence drove the school van regularly before becoming headmistress, and still does when necessary

title: ‘Necessity to eliminate the possibility of espionage,’ says Delhi HC, rejecting Turkish firm Celebi’s plea
content: ‘Unbridled access to vital installations and infrastructure naturally elevates the need for strict security vetting for operators, and their foreign affiliations,’ the court said

title: CPI(M) urges Chief Minister to intervene in the mango farmers’ crisis in Chittoor
content: The government had earlier assured the mango farmers a price of ₹12 per kg — ₹4 to be provided as a subsidy by the State, and the remaining ₹8 from pulp industry owners, CPI(M) leader pointed out

title: Kerala Governor fuelled Bharat Mata row, he must defuse it: Binoy Viswam
content: CPI State secretary says Kerala society ‘will not accept’ Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar who ‘studied in an RSS-run school and became an ideological propagator of the organisation’

title: Belgium's record scorer Wullaert ready to lead from the front vs. Spain
content: the 32-year-old striker is hoping to help her country to glory in the women's Euros . the red Flames are currently ranked 20th in the world . they face world champions Spain next and could go out if they lose and Italy beat Portugal .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Topuria? Ruffy? Wellmaker? Who owns the best KO of the year's first half?
content: the year is halfway over, and more than half of the world's 11 championships have changed hands . it's been a fertile time for the emergence of new champions and the disappearance of old champs in odd ways . Islam Makhachev announced in may he was vacating the lightweight championship .

title: CM requests Centre to allot funds for sports infra development in Telangana

title: WNBA All-Star roster breakdown: Snubs, MVP predictions, what to watch in Indianapolis
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reserves were announced Sunday . the 22 players selected for the July 19 game represent 12 of the 13 teams . a week ago the starters were released by fan, player and media balloting .

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: Paris Saint Germain beat Bayern Munich 2-0 in club world cup semifinals . champions league holders PSG come face-to-face with the 2024-25 Bundesliga champions in new york . despite two red cards, 2-0 victory could have been the final at the MetLife Stadium on July 13 . the semifinals could be the final of the match at the metlife stadium .

title: Piastri penalty: Did stewards' inconsistency cost him British GP win?
content: Oscar Piastri has claimed his first ever victory at the British Grand Prix . he responded to countless questions about the 10-second penalty that cost him victory . but he refused to elaborate on the true feelings no doubt seething inside . his ebullient teammate, race winner lando norris, had to wait alone for 25 minutes .

title: Messi's brilliant brace helps Miami rout Montreal
content: Inter Miami beat CF Montreal 4-1 in their first MLS game in over a month . Lionel Messi scored twice to help the hosts to a 4-1 win . the hosts were eliminated last week in a 4-0 defeat to Paris saint-Germain .

title: ACC preview: Road to title again figures to go through Clemson
content: the ACC crown has gone to either Dabo Swinney's Clemson Tigers or to someone who managed to beat them in the regular season . over the past 10 of those 14 years, the ac has won eight titles . last year they became the first bid thief of the expanded College Football Playoff era .
